SHLN highly rated in the Guardian Education League Tables
For the second year running Sport Science degrees at Trinity &
column2: All Saints have been commended. In 2004 we were 18 th out of 41 universities, this year we are 14 th out of 52.

column1: The Guardian University tables are designed as a simple measure of the undergraduate experience. They are aimed primarily at those who are looking to start a degree course.

Ratings are made of staff quality, entry qualifications, spend per student, student/staff ratio, value added i.e. whether less able students at entry do well on graduation, job prospects and inclusiveness.

column2: All Saints Sport Science degrees score exceptionally well on staff quality, staff/student ratio and value added criteria.

column1: With new staff members about to be appointed, the addition of a new degree programme and College investment in sports facilities watch out for the 2006 ratings.
